Authors: T.B.P., Hue, T. B.P.; D.N., Thuc, D. N.; D.T.B., Thuy, Dong Thi Bich; I., Echizen, Isao; S., Wohlgemuth, Sven
Author full names: Hue, T. B.P. (55611349600); Thuc, D. N. (55611482600); Thuy, Dong Thi Bich (8604335500); Echizen, Isao (6602366829); Wohlgemuth, Sven (14055074600)
Title: A user privacy protection technique for executing SQL over encrypted data in database outsourcing service
Source title: IFIP Advances in Information and Communication Technology
Affiliations: University of Science, Viet Nam National University Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Research Organization of Information and Systems National Institute of Informatics, Tokyo, Japan
Authors with affiliations: Hue, T. B.P., University of Science, Viet Nam National University Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Thuc, D. N., University of Science, Viet Nam National University Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Thuy, Dong Thi Bich, University of Science, Viet Nam National University Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Echizen, Isao, Research Organization of Information and Systems National Institute of Informatics, Tokyo, Japan; Wohlgemuth, Sven, Research Organization of Information and Systems National Institute of Informatics, Tokyo, Japan
Abstract: The fact that the data owners outsource their data to external service providers introduces many security and privacy issues. Among them, the most significant research questions relate to data confidentiality and user privacy. Encryption was regarded as a solution for data confidentiality. The privacy of a user is characterized by the query he poses to the server and its result. We explore the techniques to execute the SQL query over the encrypted data without revealing to the server any information about the query such as the query type or the query pattern, and its result. By implementing all the relational operators by using the unique selection operator on the server-side database with a constant number of elements in each time of selection, our proposal can defeat against the statistical attacks of the untrusted server compromising data confidentiality and user privacy. Experimental evaluation demonstrates that our proposal less affects the system's performance and is applicable in the real world. © IFIP International Federation for Information Processing 2013. © 2013 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

Authors: J., Zeng, Jing; C., Phan, Chianh; Y., Matsui, Yoshiki
Author full names: Zeng, Jing (55549584100); Phan, Chianh (36998615600); Matsui, Yoshiki (7402827345)
Title: Supply chain quality management practices and performance: An empirical study
Affiliations: Graduate School of International Social Sciences, Yokohama, Japan; Vietnam National University, Hanoi, Hanoi, Viet Nam; Yokohama National University Faculty of Business Administration, Yokohama, Japan
Authors with affiliations: Zeng, Jing, Graduate School of International Social Sciences, Yokohama, Japan; Phan, Chianh, Faculty of Business Administration, Vietnam National University, Hanoi, Hanoi, Viet Nam; Matsui, Yoshiki, Yokohama National University Faculty of Business Administration, Yokohama, Japan
Abstract: This study proposed a conceptual framework to study the relationships among three dimensions of supply chain quality management (SCQM) - in-house quality management practices (internal QM), interaction for quality with suppliers on the upstream side of supply chain (upstream QM), and interaction for quality with customers on the downstream side of supply chain (downstream QM) - and their impact on two types of quality performance (conformance quality, and customer satisfaction). Survey data were collected from 238 plants in three industries across eight countries and structural equation modeling was used to test this framework. The results indicate a dominant role of the internal QM in SCQM which has a positive impact on the other SCQM dimensions and two types of quality performance. Downstream QM is found to mediate the relationship between internal QM and customer satisfaction, while there is a lack of direct impact of upstream QM on either type of quality performance. © 2013 Springer Science+Business Media New York. © 2013 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Empirical Study; Quality Management; Quality Performance; Supply Chain

Authors: V., van Nguyen, Vinh; T.P., Nguyen, Thai Phuong; M.L., Nguyen, Minh Le; A., Shimazu, Akira
Author full names: van Nguyen, Vinh (59692583100); Nguyen, Thai Phuong (25925292600); Nguyen, Minh Le (55664630500); Shimazu, Akira (34573287200)
Title: A model lexicalized hierarchical reordering for phrase based translation
Affiliations: College of Technology, Hanoi, Viet Nam; Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology, Nomi, Japan
Authors with affiliations: van Nguyen, Vinh, College of Technology, Hanoi, Viet Nam; Nguyen, Thai Phuong, College of Technology, Hanoi, Viet Nam; Nguyen, Minh Le, Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology, Nomi, Japan; Shimazu, Akira, Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology, Nomi, Japan
Abstract: In this paper, we present a reordering model based on Maximum Entropy with local and non-local features. This model is extended from a hierarchical reordering model with PBSMT [1], which integrates rich syntactic information directly in decoder as local and non-local features of Maximum Entropy model. The advantages of this model are (1) maintaining the strength of phrase based approach with a hierarchical reordering model, (2) many kinds of rich linguistic information integrated in PBSMT as local and non-local features of MaxEntropy model. The experiment results with English-Vietnamese pair showed that our approach achieves significant improvements over the system which uses a lexical hierarchical reordering model [1]. © 2012 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

Authors: H., Ngo, Hoanglong; S., Ogawa, Shigeyoshi
Author full names: Ngo, Hoanglong (35794175500); Ogawa, Shigeyoshi (59784201500)
Title: On the discrete approximation of occupation time of diffusion processes
Affiliations: Ritsumeikan University Biwako-Kusatsu Campus, Kusatsu, Japan; Trường Đại học Sư phạm Hà Nội, Hanoi, Viet Nam
Authors with affiliations: Ngo, Hoanglong, Department of Mathematical Sciences, Ritsumeikan University Biwako-Kusatsu Campus, Kusatsu, Japan, Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, Trường Đại học Sư phạm Hà Nội, Hanoi, Viet Nam; Ogawa, Shigeyoshi, Department of Mathematical Sciences, Ritsumeikan University Biwako-Kusatsu Campus, Kusatsu, Japan
Abstract: Let X be a 1-dimensional diffusion process. We study a simple class of estimators, which rely only on one sample data, for the occupation time ∫ t <inf>0</inf>I <inf>A</inf>(X <inf>s</inf>)ds of process X in some set A. The main concern of this paper is the rates of convergence of the estimators. First, we consider the case that A is a finite union of some intervals in R, then we show that the estimator converges at rate n -3/4. Second, we consider the so-called stochastic corridor in mathematical finance. More precisely, we let A be a stochastic interval, say [X <inf>t0</inf>,∞) for some t <inf>0</inf>∈(0,t), then we show that the estimator converges at rate n -1/2. Some discussions about the exactness of the rates are also presented. © 2012 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Diffusion; Discrete Approximation; Local Time; Occupation Time; Stable Convergence; Tightness

Title: Quality management practices and competitive performance: Empirical evidence from Japanese manufacturing companies
Affiliations: VNU University of Economics and Business, Hanoi, Viet Nam; Yokohama National University Faculty of Business Administration, Yokohama, Japan; Applied Science Private University, Amman, Jordan
Authors with affiliations: Phan, Chianh, VNU University of Economics and Business, Hanoi, Viet Nam, Yokohama National University Faculty of Business Administration, Yokohama, Japan; Abdallah, Ayman Bahjat, Faculty of Economics and Administrative Sciences, Applied Science Private University, Amman, Jordan; Matsui, Yoshiki, Yokohama National University Faculty of Business Administration, Yokohama, Japan
Abstract: This paper presents the results of an empirical study on the relationship between quality management practices and competitive performance in Japanese manufacturing companies. The data was gathered from two surveys including the common sample of twenty-seven Japanese manufacturing companies in the 1990s and the 2000s. Statistical techniques are used to compare the degree of implementation of the eleven quality management practices and their impact on different dimensions of competitive performance between two periods. Findings of this study highlight the stability and consistency of the Japanese quality management, which can be used as one of the strategic weapons for maintaining competitive advantage of Japanese manufacturing companies. © 2011 Elsevier B.V. All right reserved. © 2011 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

Authors: H., Ngo, Hoanglong
Author full names: Ngo, Hoanglong (35794175500)
Title: Parametric estimation for discretely observed stochastic processes with jumps
Affiliations: Ritsumeikan University Biwako-Kusatsu Campus, Kusatsu, Japan; Trường Đại học Sư phạm Hà Nội, Hanoi, Viet Nam
Authors with affiliations: Ngo, Hoanglong, Department of Mathematical Sciences, Ritsumeikan University Biwako-Kusatsu Campus, Kusatsu, Japan, Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, Trường Đại học Sư phạm Hà Nội, Hanoi, Viet Nam
Abstract: We consider a two dimensional stochastic process (X, Y), which may have jump components and is not necessarily ergodic. There is an unknown parameter θ within the coefficients of (X, Y). The aim of this paper is to estimate θ from a regularly spaced sample of the process (X, Y). When the dynamic of X is known, an estimator is constructed by using a moment-based method. We show that our estimators will work if the Blumenthal-Getoor index of the jump part of Y is less than 2. What is perhaps the most interesting is the rate at which the estimators converge: it is 1/√n (as when the underlying processes are not contaminated by jumps) when that index is not greater than 1. When the dynamic of X is unknown, we introduce a spot volatility estimator-based approach to estimate θ. This approach can work even if the sample is contaminated by microstructure noise. © 2010, Institute of Mathematical Statistics. All rights reserved. © 2017 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Blumenthal-getoor Index; Discrete Observation; Jump Process; Microstructure Noise; Non-ergodic Process; Nonparameric Estimation; Parametric Estimation

Title: Measuring accumulated revelations of private information by multiple media
Source title: IFIP Advances in Information and Communication Technology
Affiliations: The University of Electro-Communications, Chofu, Japan; University of Science, Viet Nam National University Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Research Organization of Information and Systems National Institute of Informatics, Tokyo, Japan; The University of Electro-Communications, Chofu, Japan

Abstract: A metric has been developed for measuring privacy degradation when various types of media reveal private information about a person. The metric, which is based on joint entropy, quantifies accumulated revelations of information about various personal attributes. Application of this metric to entries posted on a social networking service and to leaks from a company database containing personal information showed that it is effective; that is, it can quantify accumulated revelations of information about multiple attributes and can cope with cases in which the attributes affect each other. © 2010 IFIP International Federation for Information Processing. © 2019 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

Title: Associations of psychosocial factors with maternal confidence among Japanese and vietnamese mothers
Source title: Journal of Child and Family Studies
Affiliations: Fukushima Medical University, Fukushima, Japan; Hanh Phuc Women and Children Hospital Project, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; University of Medicine and Pharmacy at HCMC, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Tu Du Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Public Health Section, Sukagawa City, Japan
Authors with affiliations: Goto, Aya, Department of Public Health, Fukushima Medical University, Fukushima, Japan; Nguyen, Quang Vinh, Hanh Phuc Women and Children Hospital Project, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; van Nguyen, Thi Tu, Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, University of Medicine and Pharmacy at HCMC, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Pham, Nghiem Minh, Tu Du Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Chung, Thi Mong Thuy, Tu Du Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Trinh, Huu Phuc, Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, University of Medicine and Pharmacy at HCMC, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Yabe, Junko, Social Health and Welfare Department, Public Health Section, Sukagawa City, Japan; Sasaki, Hitomi, Department of Public Health, Fukushima Medical University, Fukushima, Japan; Yasumura, Seiji, Department of Public Health, Fukushima Medical University, Fukushima, Japan
Abstract: We conducted this cross-sectional study among 392 Japanese and 294 Vietnamese mothers who attended routine child health visits in a Japanese city and at a tertiary hospital in Vietnam, in order to investigate the prevalence and associated sociodemographic, parenting, and psychological characteristics of low maternal confidence in child rearing among them. All data were collected from medical files in Japan, and from medical files and self-administered questionnaires in Vietnam. The proportion of mothers without secure feeling of confidence in the present study was 22% in Japan and 66% in Vietnam. Significant factors associated with a lack of confidence were first-time motherhood and unintended pregnancy in the Japanese dataset and younger age in the Vietnamese dataset. In both groups, a higher proportion of mothers who lacked confidence reported negative parenting outcomes than did confident mothers. Among the three psychological measurements (mood, self-efficacy and depression), higher self-efficacy was associated independently with a significantly reduced risk of not having confidence in child rearing. These results suggest the importance of developing parenting support programs to help Japanese and Vietnamese mothers, particularly those who are young, first-time mothers or who became pregnant unexpectedly, improve their self-efficacy. © Springer Science+Business Media, LLC 2009. © 2010 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

Authors: C., Vo, Cong; M., Muramatsu, Masakazu; M., Kojima, Masakazu
Author full names: Vo, Cong (24339719900); Muramatsu, Masakazu (7201729537); Kojima, Masakazu (55914896300)
Title: Equality based contraction of semidefinite programming relaxations in polynomial optimization
Source title: Journal of the Operations Research Society of Japan
Affiliations: DaiTri Joint Stock Company, Viet Nam; The University of Electro-Communications; Institute of Science Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan
Authors with affiliations: Vo, Cong, DaiTri Joint Stock Company, Viet Nam; Muramatsu, Masakazu, The University of Electro-Communications; Kojima, Masakazu, Institute of Science Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan
Abstract: The SDP (semidefinite programming) relaxation for general POPs (polynomial optimization problems), which was proposed as a method for computing global optimal solutions of POPs by Lasserre, has become an active research subject recently. We propose a new heuristic method exploiting the equality constraints in a given POP, and strengthen the SDP relaxation so as to achieve faster convergence to the global optimum of the POP. We can apply this method to both of the dense SDP relaxation which was originally proposed by Lasserre, and the sparse SDP relaxation which was later proposed by Kim, Kojima, Muramatsu and Waki. Especially, our heuristic method incorporated into the sparse SDP relaxation method has shown a promising performance in numerical experiments on large scale sparse POPs. Roughly speaking, we induce valid equality constraints from the original equality constraints of the POP, and then use them to convert the dense or sparse SDP relaxation into a new stronger SDP relaxation. Our method is enlightened by some strong theoretical results on the convergence of SDP relaxations for POPs with equality constraints provided by Lasserre, Parrilo, and Laurent, but we place the main emphasis on the practical aspect to compute more accurate lower bounds of larger sparse POPs. © 2018 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Equality Constraints; Exploiting Sparsity; Global Optimization; Nonlinear Programming; Optimization; Polynomial Optimization; Semidefinite Programming

Abstract: A new approach is proposed for optimizing a polynomial fractional function under polynomial constraints, or more generally, a synomial fractional function under synomial constraints. The approach is based on reformulating the problem as the optimization of an increasing function under monotonic constraints. © 2012 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

Authors: H., Van-Nam, Huynh; Y., Yoshiteru Nakamori, Yoshiteru; T., Ho, Tubao; G., Resconi, Germano
Author full names: Van-Nam, Huynh (7003274638); Yoshiteru Nakamori, Yoshiteru (7004293554); Ho, Tubao (24472876700); Resconi, Germano (35579694600)
Title: A context model for fuzzy concept analysis based upon modal logic
Affiliations: Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology, Nomi, Japan; Università Cattolica del Sacro Cuore, Campus di Brescia, Brescia, Italy; Quy Nhon University, Quy Nhon City, Binh Dinh Province, Viet Nam
Authors with affiliations: Van-Nam, Huynh, School of Knowledge Science, Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology, Nomi, Japan, Quy Nhon University, Quy Nhon City, Binh Dinh Province, Viet Nam; Yoshiteru Nakamori, Yoshiteru, School of Knowledge Science, Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology, Nomi, Japan; Ho, Tubao, School of Knowledge Science, Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology, Nomi, Japan; Resconi, Germano, Università Cattolica del Sacro Cuore, Campus di Brescia, Brescia, Italy
Abstract: In this paper we present interesting relationships between the context model, modal logic and fuzzy concept analysis. It has been shown that the context model proposed by Gebhardt and Kruse [Int. J. Approx. Reason. 9 (1993) 283] can be semantically extended and considered as a data model for fuzzy concept analysis within the framework of the meta-theory developed by Resconi et al. in 1990s. Consequently, the context model provides a practical framework for constructing membership functions of fuzzy concepts and gives the basis for a theoretical justification of suitably use of well-known t-norm based connectives such as min-max and product-sum rules in applications. Furthermore, an interpretation of mass assignments of fuzzy concepts within the context model is also established. © 2003 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved. © 2008 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

Authors: H., Konno, Hiroshi; N., Kawadai, Naoya; H., Tuy, Hoàng
Author full names: Konno, Hiroshi (7201801289); Kawadai, Naoya (6508166261); Tuy, Hoàng (55959185000)
Title: Cutting plane algorithms for nonlinear semi-definite programming problems with applications
Affiliations: Chuo University, Hachioji, Japan; Institute of Science Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan; Hanoi Institute of Mathematics, Hanoi, Viet Nam
Authors with affiliations: Konno, Hiroshi, Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering, Chuo University, Hachioji, Japan; Kawadai, Naoya, Department of Industrial Engineering and Management, Institute of Science Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan; Tuy, Hoàng, Institute of Mathematics, Hanoi Institute of Mathematics, Hanoi, Viet Nam
Abstract: We will propose an outer-approximation (cutting plane) method for minimizing a function f X subject to semi-definite constraints on the variables X ε R n×n. A number of efficient algorithms have been proposed when the objective function is linear. However, there are very few practical algorithms when the objective function is nonlinear. An algorithm to be proposed here is a kind of outer-approximation(cutting plane) method, which has been successfully applied to several low rank global optimization problems including generalized convex multiplicative programming problems and generalized linear fractional programming problems, etc. We will show that this algorithm works well when f is convex and n is relatively small. Also, we will provide the proof of its convergence under various technical assumptions. © 2003 Kluwer Academic Publishers. © 2012 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Cutting Plane Algorithm; Ellipsoidal Separation; Low Rank Nonconvex Problem; Outer-approximation; Quadratic Regression; Semi-definite Logit Model; Semi-definite Programming; Semi-infinite Programming

Abstract: BMIR-JP is the lirat complete Japanese test collection available for use in evaluating information retrieval systems. It contains sixty queries and the IDS of 5080 newspaper articles in the fields of economics and engineering. The queries are classified into five categories, based on the functions the system is likely to use to interpret them correctly and retrieve relevant texts. This collection has two levels of relevance, topically relevant and partially relevant. Also discussed are design issues such as collection types and size. This collection and the principles derived in designing it should be helpful in the future development of new test collections. © 2023 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.
